experience: You and Marc both know JD Lasica, John Furrier, and 54 others
Marc can introduce you to 6 people at Facebook
My claim to fame: I gave Marc Benioff his first job.
Deciding on the graphics for my custom-shaped Pearson Arrow board. Vote for one: straight lines or curved. The pentagon is a placeholder for the Pearson Arrow logo.

ComoBlue – Software application development company for Social Networks.•	Develop ideation, product strategy and business processes for Facebook and mobile applications.•	Business development consultant with Facebook, mobile developers, ad networks and companies.•	Manage and run the Facebook & Casual Games Meetup Group with over 760 developers.•	Work with potential sponsors to monetize applications in the social media marketplace.

Provide early-stage capital, business development and management consulting for technology companies.•	Entrepreneur-in-residence, subject matter expert, judge and mentor for funding grants at the Center for Commercialization of Advanced Technology for Homeland Security.•	Work with entrepreneurs by providing valuable coaching, mentoring, capital, and networking with VC’s.•	Partner in developing their business plans, setting marketing strategies, positioning products, identifying project opportunities, social media promotions and implementing sales channels strategies.•	Create and review business development plans, term sheets, partnerships and licensing agreements.

First CRM internet marketing automation software company.•	Managed and implemented the strategic business development / OEM channel programs that generated over $5 million in revenue opportunities.•	Closed complex contract negotiations with key major accounts including SAP AG, Clarify, USWeb/CKS, SalesLogix, and Nortel Networks, which generated over $1 million in sales.•	Was the 16th person hired, and helped grow the company to over 240 employees with a $450 million valuation.•	Identified and established strategic business relationships with Microsoft, Sun, Oracle, Acxiom, Exodus, and mySAP that increased revenue by $1.5 million.•	Managed, identified and enhanced strategic customer relationships and projects for cross selling and retention.

First B2B suite of buy-sell, sell-side integrated software in the marketplace.•	Established the Netscape and GE Information Services channel organization that generated 100% of the $50 million annual run rate. •	Organized sales, product training, and diplomatically managed marketing projects and strategic partnership development.•	Identified, recruited, collaborated and managed strategic business relationships and projects with Sun, HP, IBM, Oracle, Digital and system integrators KPMG / Ernst &Young to expand revenue opportunities over $1 million.•	Developed and implemented training to over 200 sales representatives and 50 professional service consultants.•	Managed an aggressive sales channel roll out program, which helped Actra to grow to a $127 million market valuation before the Netscape acquisition in December 1997.

Helped IBM build a new world-wide organization and managed Netscape.•	Relocated to Austin to develop a competitive project analysis and strategic proposal to fund IBM’s new $20 million organization, which saved over $2 million in IBM’s Alliance Program.•	Relocated back to Silicon Valley to manage the Netscape partnership.•	Increased the strategic IBM OEM market share with Netscape from 1% to 25% in one year.•	Expanded revenue opportunities over $2 million in North America and Europe by managing the Netscape strategic business development channel relationship with IBM.•	Negotiated significant new business opportunities and contract terms with strategic software providers to accelerate IBM’s revenue opportunities into a new marketplace.•	Managed and lead an IBM Virtual Team of multiple divisions, channels, management, and sales.

Marc is a savvy individual angel investor who has a good understanding of the fundamentals for success with early stage and rapidly growing companies.  We met several years ago when he was considering investment in CEYX Technologies, a company for which I was serving as a contract CFO.  Our relationship continued long after the deal and evolved into a business friendship in which we often trade deal info and help vet new deals.  I always appreciate Marc's insights and perspective in any deal and would recommend his services highly to anyone.

summary: •	I'm a business executive with a record of assuming strong leadership roles in         rapidly expanding technology companies.•	Entrepreneur-in-residence, subject matter expert, judge, mentor and board member for funding         grants at the Center of Commercialization of advanced Technology for Department of         Homeland Security.•	Professor at JP Catholic University teaching business management, strategic marketing, and         social media classes. Also managing their LaunchPad business incubator program.•	Develop ideation, social gaming, product strategy and social media marketing for Facebook           and mobile applications.•	Angel investor and executive entrepreneur providing early-stage capital and mentoring.• I have had over 20 years of marketing, sales, business development, strategic partnerships and   executive management experience in technology companies, including Hewlett-Packard, IBM,   Actra (Netscape & GE Joint Venture), and MarketFirst. • While at Actra, I managed an aggressive sales channel which helped Actra grow to a $127 million    market valuation before the Netscape acquisition. • At MarketFirst, I helped grow the company to over 240 employees with a $450 million valuation.Experienced In: - Managing strategic partnerships - Identifying new business opportunities- Teaching business and marketing classes - Mentoring start-up companies- Managing technical contracts- Developing Facebook applications- Creating partnership licensing agreements- Negotiating complex contracts- Managing incubator programs- Driving key internal stakeholders- Managing major sales accounts- Communicating with C-level managementSpecialties: My industry experience includes social gaming, social media, enterprise software, mobile wireless, consumer marketplace, collaborative software, manufacturing, telecommunication, multimedia, security, social networking and managing business incubator programs.
name: Marc Burch
title: Founder, CEO at ComoBlue and Angel Investor
